intro: Celosia pallida, commonly known as the pale celosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, plume-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, with a soft, feathery appearance. Celosia pallida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant and long-lasting blooms.
